content.description:
Do the same start as

Happy

, but climb the ramping, leftward diagonalling crack to avoid the very overhanging wall below. Climb up through horizontal placements and small roofs. Cross over to the left and climb past 1 bolt(5.9+) to gain the featured slab above. This is a worthy little pile of poop....
content.protection: Gear to 2" and 1 bolt protects this imaginative line.

content.description: Start up a left-leaning, left facing corner on gritty rock. Cross over the diorite dike, and climb moderate corners up and right on gear placements to the 2-bolt anchor at the top.
content.protection: There are no bolts on this line. It has a 2-bolt anchor for descent.
content.location: Sleepy is the furthest route to the right up the sloping base of the Little Weston Wall.

content.description:
Starting just to the right of the

Bashful

corner, climb up the lower tier past 2 bolts (5.10a). Peggy-O climbs just left of the overhanging arete through the 1st roof (10c) and crosses to the steep side of the arete through the 2nd roof (5.10+)! Finish up the same steep, 30 foot, leftward-leaning finger crack finish (5.9 with medium size gear) to the 2-bolt anchor.
content.protection: Mostly bolts with some gear to 2” and a 2-bolt anchor with chains for descent.
content.location:
Start just right of the

Bashful

corner past the obvious, bolt protected face.

content.description: Start up the steep featured rock to one bolt. Continue straight up past a few more bolts and some powerful and wild sequences (5.10c). Join cracks and get gear placements to finish up this fun pitch.
content.protection: 3 bolts and gear to 3". There is a 2-bolt anchor at the top.
content.location: Happy climbs up the center of the upper right side of the wall.

content.description:
Grumpy has now been bolted and requires powerful and tricky climbing. It is sequential! It starts left of

Dopey

in the steep diorite corner pulling through the tough double roof (5.11b/c?). Continue up the moderate corner, then step out left on awesome features. Crank the steep roof/corner(5.10+) to finish up this wild, little route.
content.protection:
Grumpy shares a 2-bolt anchor with

Dopey

.

content.description: Dopey pulls through a steep hand crack start (5.10a) to reach better rock above. Climb past a bolt to the moderate terrain above. Cracks lead up to the undercling roof above.... Pull through the roof past the 1 bolt finish up to the 2-bolt anchor.

Bashful is the obvious, right-facing, diorite dihedral on the far left side of the crag. The line climbs out the far left side of the huge roof up on to the slab above. The final 30 feet (5.9-) follows the leftward-diagonalling crack all the way to the top of the buttress and the anchor chains.
content.protection: Gear to 2.5” and a 2-bolt anchor with chains for descent.
content.location: Start up a nice hand rack in the ramping corner near the lowest toe of the left side of the crag. Continue up the stem box aiming for the obvious, right-facing corner above (5.8). Pull out the huge roof on its left side (5.6). Continue up the slab to face the steep, leftward-leaning finger crack finish (5.9) up to the 2-bolt anchor.
